description: Dive into "Stuttgart's Love Journey: Romantic Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Stuttgart's Love Journey: Romantic Escapes

places.generalDescription: A

sources.snippet: Stuttgart, Germany offers a perfect blend of modern and traditional architecture, one of the city's biggest attractions is the Porsche Museum. Visitors on a limited budget can enjoy the city's green spaces, visit museums on discounted days, and explore the local markets for affordable meals. Thrifty travelers can save money by using public transportation, purchasing a Stuttgart City Card, and staying in budget-friendly accommodations.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A romantic day trip to Stuttgart, Germany

sources.snippet: Porsche's vehicles, with their sexy lines and powerful engines, have been aspirational cars for generations. If you want your own dose of inspiration, head to the Porsche Museum where the company's history and cars are on display at this world-class museum. Take the long elevator ride up to the museum floor and be prepared to be awed.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: With its emphasis on modern cars, the Porsche Museum offers a different experience to car lovers. This place is packed with every type of sports car that the company has designed. If you are the kind of person who always fantasized with owning a large sports car, then surely this is your own Shangri-La.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: As Stuttgart is a city of cars, there‚Äôs another car museum worth visiting ‚Äì the Porsche Museum. The museum is located in Zuffenhausen, Northwest of Stuttgart and further than the Mercedes Museum.
sources.shortName: 28 Unique Things To Do in Stuttgart, Germany [2025] -

sources.snippet: Porsche Museum: F√ºr Auto-Enthusiasten ist das Porsche Museum ein Muss. Bewundern Sie die legend√§ren Sportwagen und lernen Sie mehr √ºber die Geschichte dieser ber√ºhmten Marke.
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

sources.snippet: A further car highlight of Stuttgart is the Porsche Museum; its external architecture alone is a real work of art. The same goes for the interior of the museum.
sources.shortName: Tourist sites in and around Stuttgart

sources.snippet: The Porsche Museum in Stuttgart is a must-visit for car enthusiasts, showcasing the history, innovations, and iconic models of the prestigious brand.
sources.shortName: Stuttgart, Germany  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

places.name: Porsche Museum

reviews.text:
Amazing place for petrol heads. Come early to get a good parking spot. Love that kids have a reduced ticket.
All the cars displayed are beautiful and showcase how time has affected change in the newer builds. The whole museum can be covered in 2-4 hours. Depending on the level of time you have at hand.
The interactive race was what my son enjoyed the most. But a pic with Sally is a must. I should warn you, the gift shop is where you will spend a lot of money. There is a lot that you will like there so better come prepared.

The museum is well curated. A must for a Porsche fan or a good place to see nice cars for any car enthusiasts. You'll probably spend an hour to finish the whole thing or could go up to 3 hours if you want to go into details of each car and its story.

Open on Sunday with a cafe and two restaurants inside. The cafe is average, all good design but not as good coffee. The restaurant serve nice food with reasonable price.

The weather was perfect on the day of our Porsche Museum visit, which made the whole experience even more enjoyable. The sleek, modern architecture of the building stood out beautifully under the clear skies. Inside, the collection was absolutely stunning ‚Äì from vintage classics to futuristic prototypes. Each exhibit was thoughtfully displayed, with great attention to detail and interactive elements. The atmosphere was relaxed yet inspiring. Friendly staff and well-organized layouts made it easy to explore.

places.generalDescription: The Mercedes-Benz Museum in Stuttgart offers a captivating journey through 125 years of automotive history, showcasing vintage and modern vehicles that have shaped the car industry. The museum's sleek architecture mirrors the curves of high-speed race cars, setting the stage for an impressive collection that appeals to both avid car enthusiasts and those with a passing interest in automotive engineering. Visitors can explore key historical events intertwined with the evolution of automobiles, including poignant memories captured in photographs.

sources.snippet: A trip to the Mercedes-Benz Museum takes you in a time travel through the history of the birth of the automobile in Germany, and the rise of Mercedes-Benz as one of the best car manufacturers in the world. Through its halls you can see every one of their models, from the earliest steam powered vehicles to their exciting sport racing models, and even bold futuristic models that for some reason didn‚Äôt reach production. The museum offers a guided audio tour through the history of Mercedes-Benz.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: The Mercedes Benz Museum is more than a museum dedicated to vehicles, this huge museum (over 180,000 square feet) covers 130 years of automobile history and changes in society and world events, including both world wars. Cars, buses, and even the Popemobile and the SUV used in the movie Jurassic Park are on display, along with race cars and airplane engines. The building itself is an attraction, an architectural marvel in the form of a double helix.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: The modern automobile was invented by Karl Benz, with his patent of the ‚ÄúMotorwagen‚Äù in 1886 and the ‚ÄúMercedes‚Äù part of the name comes from an associate, Emil Jellinek‚Äôs daughter‚Äôs name ‚ÄúMercedes‚Äù. One of the most famous places to visit in Germany is the Mercedes-Benz Museum. An impressive structure that dominates the skyline with its double helix interior designed to maximize space and proudly displays 160 vehicles!
sources.shortName: 17 UNIQUE Things to Do in Stuttgart [in 2024]

sources.snippet: The Mercedes-Benz Museum is also a must-visit, showcasing the history of this renowned car manufacturer and engaging visitors of all ages with its fascinating displays. Don't forget to immerse yourselves in the local culture by enjoying a leisurely stroll through the beautiful Rosenstein Park, featuring stunning landscapes and charming gardens.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A romantic day trip to Stuttgart, Germany

sources.snippet: The city is home to many automakers including Mercedes (Daimler) and Porsche. The Mercedes Museum is a multi-story complex that winds it‚Äôs way up, taking you through over 125 years of car history.
sources.shortName: 28 Unique Things To Do in Stuttgart, Germany [2025] -

sources.snippet: A further car highlight of Stuttgart is the Porsche Museum; its external architecture alone is a real work of art. The same goes for the interior of the museum.
sources.shortName: Tourist sites in and around Stuttgart

sources.snippet: The Mercedes-Benz Museum in Stuttgart showcases the fascinating history of the iconic automobile brand, featuring over 160 vehicles and numerous exhibits.
sources.shortName: Stuttgart, Germany  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025
52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Mercedes-Benz Museum

reviews.text:
I really enjoyed my visit to the Mercedes-Benz Museum in Stuttgart. The building is spectacular, and the way the exhibitions are laid out makes it easy to follow the history of the automobile from the very beginning up to modern times. The variety of vehicles on display is impressive, from the earliest cars to racing legends and special one-offs. It's a place where you could easily spend hours without noticing the time pass.

Most of the staff were exactly what you would expect in a museum of this caliber: welcoming, polite, and professional. But unfortunately, one staff member (see photo) stood out in the worst possible way. She was stationed at the entrance to remind people about the rules regarding bags and drinks, which is of course a necessary task. However, instead of doing it in a respectful or friendly manner, she came across as outright rude. It wasn't just with us-she seemed to treat every visitor in the same abrupt and dismissive way.

There are countless ways to enforce rules while still showing basic respect, but she chose the opposite approach. Zero sense of social competence, and frankly the wrong person for that job. It left a very sour taste and is something the management should take seriously. One unfriendly encounter can damage the atmosphere that the rest of the staff work so hard to create.

That said, the museum itself is absolutely worth visiting. The cars, the architecture, and the storytelling are world-class. But I sincerely hope the management reconsiders who they put in front of guests, because one person's behavior should not be allowed to drag down an otherwise fantastic experience.

Highly recommend, amazing car with professionally designed museum layout. A lift will take you to the top floor and you will walk down to the first floor. I the halls connecting the floors there are historical pictures so you can easily correlate the cars to the history like Kennedy presidency or man on the moon. This makes it absolutely easy to understand when that car were rushing through streets!

I was very pleased with my visit to the Mercedes-Benz Museum. It's an excellent combination of showcasing the evolution of Mercedes and the broader progress of German industry and society throughout history. The exhibitions are modern, rich in content, and interesting for both adults and children. The entire space is clean, spacious, and very well organized. I recommend buying tickets online ‚Äì it's easy and helps avoid waiting. There's also a large, convenient parking area. This museum is a must-see for anyone visiting Stuttgart!

places.generalDescription: Wilhelma Zoological and Botanic Garden is a vast zoo and botanical garden located in a former royal park dating back to the 19th century. Originally created as a private retreat for Swabian King Wilhelm, it has now become one of Germany's largest zoos, attracting over two million visitors annually. The site features Neo-Moorish style buildings set amidst lush gardens, offering a unique setting for its diverse collection of animals and plants.

sources.snippet: The Wilhelma Zoo is a wonderful place where you can enjoy nature, not from afar like in many other zoos, but immersed right in the middle of animals and plants from all over the world. Beautifully designed with the style of an European garden, the zoo also offers a great place where to sit with family or friends and do a picnic, or enjoy a beer or ice cream with the natural scenery of the place as your background. The Wilhelma is the perfect place where to find refuge from the modern world inside a beautiful park filled with nature.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: Although this is one of Europe's largest zoological parks, visitors from North America could be forgiven for thinking that it feels small, and compared to what you find in San Diego or other major centers, it is. What is most impressive is the Neo-Moorish architecture, a good selection of unique animals, and stunning botanical gardens. The zoological park is a fantastic family outing.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: Right in the heart of the city, Wilhelma Zoo is a beautiful zoo with a large variety of animal species. It is also home to the only zoological-botanical gardens in Germany with over 7,000 species of plants. In the summer the zoo is a magnificent display of color and greenery.
sources.shortName: 28 Unique Things To Do in Stuttgart, Germany [2025] -

sources.snippet: Wilhelma Zoologisch-Botanischer Garten: Verbringen Sie den Tag damit, exotische Tiere zu entdecken und durch die sch√∂nen botanischen G√§rten zu schlendern.
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

sources.snippet: Wilhelma Zoo and Botanical Garden is a unique attraction in Stuttgart, combining a zoo, botanical garden, and historical park in one location.
sources.shortName: Stuttgart, Germany  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025
Top Things to do in Stuttgart: More Than Just Fast Cars.

places.name: Wilhelma - Zoological-botanical garden

reviews.text:
The Wilhelma Zoo and Botanical Garden in Stuttgart is truly an incredible place! I honestly didn't expect it to be so impressive. The grounds are spacious, green, and absolutely beautiful - full of flowers, trees, and charming historic buildings. Walking through it feels like strolling through a fairytale park.

There's a huge variety of animals - from elephants and giraffes to the cutest koalas and vibrant tropical birds. The butterfly house was especially unforgettable - it's pure magic watching butterflies fly right past you. And the monkeys and penguins? Totally captivating!

The whole area is so cozy and thoughtfully designed, with plenty of benches, caf√©s, and quiet places to relax. You can tell the animals are well cared for, and everything is done with love. It's definitely one of the most wonderful places I've ever visited. If you're ever in Stuttgart - don't miss it!And if it were possible I would give it 10 stars, I'm delighted!üòçüòç

The best zoo in the world. I've been to all the London zoos and lots more throughout the UK and internationally - this must be the best zoo ever!
It's spacious, beautiful, clean. It wasn't busy or crowded at all, even on a Sunday.
Also it's huge with so many animals! Which on the whole seem happy and looked after. And the gardens and greenhouses are stunning.
Even the food and canteens/restaurants are lovely.
We had the best day ever. And there's so many play areas for kids as well. 10/10 you have to come if you're in the area. You won't regret it.

Beautiful garden + zoo which is so nicely maintained. The garden is spectacular. There is the cactus area which would mesmerize all garden lovers. The surroundings are well kept. The Amazon experience is amazing. The animals can be viewed closely, that's how the landscaping is done for their enclosures. Multiple restaurants are within the Wilhelma zoo.
Not to forget some lucky ones even got peacock feathers. We visited on a Saturday with kids and it was a day well spent.

places.generalDescription: Schloss Solitude, a stunning rococo palace built between 1764 and 1769 for Duke Carl Eugen, is a must-visit gem located just outside Stuttgart. This magnificent structure not only boasts breathtaking views but also features delightful hiking trails that invite exploration of the surrounding lush forests. As you wander through its opulent halls, you'll discover fascinating artifacts from its history as a private hunting lodge. The serene gardens offer a perfect backdrop for memorable moments with friends or family.

sources.snippet: Located on a scenic vantage point a few miles outside of Stuttgart's city center, Schloss Solitude (Solitude Palace) was built for Duke Karl Eugen in 1763 as a hunting lodge and summer residence. Designed in the late Rococo and early Neoclassical styles, the most sumptuously decorated rooms are in the central pavilion. Its highlight is the radiant Weisse Saal (White Hall) with its lovely domed roof, intricate decorative goldwork, and frescoed ceiling.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: Located west of Stuttgart just outside of the city, Schloss Solitude is a large palace built high on a hilltop. The views are great and the grounds are large with many trails and a large lawn area out front. Duke Carl Eugen von W√ºrttemberg built the palace in 1763 to be a lodge and hunting grounds.
sources.shortName: 28 Unique Things To Do in Stuttgart, Germany [2025] -
52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Schloss Solitude

reviews.text: Very nice place to walk by, have a picnic or just chill in the sun. It is free to go around and there is a cafe nearby. At the forest, there is some barbecue area. Although, there is no stairs to walk around the castle, the pathway is a little tricky for wheelchairs users.

Schloss Solitude is a stunning Rococo palace with breathtaking views over Stuttgart. The architecture is elegant, and the surrounding nature makes it a perfect escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Whether you're here for a picnic, a walk through the forest, or simply to admire the sunset, the atmosphere is always serene.

The viewing platform offers fantastic panoramic views, and the walking trails around the palace make it a great spot for leisure activities. While the palace interior is only accessible via guided tours, the exterior alone is worth the visit. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a peaceful retreat with historical charm.

There is a sign "No cars allowed" at the entrance of the alley, leading to the castle - 400m. One with disabilities would have difficulties. Please note that at the end there are 2 parking places and a charger for e-vehicles.

places.generalDescription: The City Library at the Mail√§nder Platz in Stuttgart is a modern, cube-like structure with a minimalist and light-filled interior. It offers a unique reading experience with books from various authors and printers worldwide. Visitors can relax and enjoy their reading in the basement lockers or savor snacks from the cafeteria. On sunny days, they can even read on the open roof terrace, which provides stunning city views and a wonderful atmosphere.

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: City Library at the Mail√§nder Platz

reviews.text: Most modern library I have been to in Europe so far. Stunning interior architecture with a large open centre, revealing the different floors. The material in the library covers a wide range of topics. Ample reading and studying areas with sofas, desks and workstations.

l think it was best library I have ever seen. It was very close to station and the center. The design is very nice. It can be visited freely. There is a cafe on the top floor. there are resources from all languages in one section, cleverly.

Free entry and super easy to visit if you're strolling around the city. The interior design is simple and clean but somehow still feels unique. There's a caf√© on the top floor where you can kick back and relax, plus you can head up to the rooftop to take in a great view of the city. It's the perfect spot to pause and soak up the atmosphere.

places.generalDescription: Schlossplatz is a central square in Stuttgart, known for its gardens and the 1841 Jubilee Column. It's a hub of cultural activity with open-air concerts and summer festivals. The area also showcases modern sculptures by renowned artists like Alexander Calder, Alfred Hrdlicka, and Otto Hajek. Street art enthusiasts will appreciate the city's creative scene, including a popular tourist attraction called the Hall of Fame in Bad Cannstatt.

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Schlossplatz

reviews.text: Some places aren't just beautiful - they speak to something inside you. Schlossplatz is one of them. The old stones seem to hold quiet stories, and the evening light paints the buildings like someone is brushing the city with love. I just stood there, listening to a violinist, soaking in the moment. If you're nearby - don't rush past. There's a kind of peace here, even in the middle of the crowd.
Great place to visit and grab a bite to eat. Beautiful and very picturesque. We were there during UEFA Nation's League Cup and the atmosphere was electrifying

Stuttgart's Schlossplatz is so much more than just a large, central square-it's the city's living room. Stepping onto the expansive grounds, you immediately feel the weight of history meeting the lightness of modern life. The sheer grandeur of the New Palace, with its creamy fa√ßade and stately presence, is captivating. Yet, what makes Schlossplatz truly special isn't the architecture alone, but the way it's used.
On a sun-drenched afternoon, the green lawns are a patchwork of people enjoying life. Students studying, friends sharing a picnic, families letting their kids run free-the atmosphere is one of relaxed, communal joy. The ornate fountains, with their gentle splashing, provide a soothing soundtrack to the urban buzz. And at the heart of it all, the Jubilee Column rises like a proud sentinel, crowned by the elegant figure of Concordia, the goddess of harmony. This monument, built to honor King Wilhelm I, perfectly encapsulates the plaza's purpose: a space for the people, for unity, and for shared experiences.
I've seen Schlossplatz transform from a vibrant open-air concert venue to a magical Christmas market wonderland, complete with a skating rink. It's the place where the city celebrates, mourns, and simply exists. It's a reminder that a city's soul isn't just in its buildings, but in the people who bring them to life. Whether you're a tourist or a local, spending time at Schlossplatz is not just visiting a landmark; it's participating in the heartbeat of Stuttgart.

places.generalDescription: Santiago de Chile Square, nestled in Stuttgart-Haigst, is a hidden gem that offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city. Accessible via the charming cogwheel train known as "Zacke," this serene spot provides an ideal escape from the hustle and bustle. With its elevated position at nearly 500 meters, visitors can soak in stunning vistas of Palace Square and Charlotte Square while enjoying a peaceful atmosphere with minimal crowds.

sources.snippet: Der ultimative Dating-Spot in Stuttgart schlechthin: Der Santiago-de-Chile Platz ist ein perfekter Ort, um den Sundowner zu genie√üen und den Blick √ºber den Kessel schweifen zu lassen. Die B√§nke laden zum Verweilen ein, packt euren Lieblingsgwein ein und lehnt euch zur√ºck!. Aber Warnung, die Aussicht ist so atemberaubend, also nicht den Liebsten aus den Augen verlieren.
sources.shortName: Dating-Spots in Stuttgart

places.name: Santiago de Chile Place

reviews.text: Great viewpoint. For full experience would recommend getting the Zacke after for more nice angles!!
Very nice view - Stuttgart from the top!
A great overview of stuttgart ... chilling in summer and beautiful lights in clear winter days.

places.generalDescription: Schillerplatz is a grand and historic cobblestone square located in the Old Town of Stuttgart. It features a statue commemorating Friedrich Schiller, a renowned German poet, philosopher, historian, and dramatist. The square hosts a vibrant flower market on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday mornings and is also part of the annual Christmas Market in December.

sources.snippet: Flanking the Old Palace is Schillerplatz, an old town square with a monument to Friedrich Schiller, poet, philosopher, historian, and dramatist - one of Germany's most famous cultural giants. The square is the site of a flower market on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday mornings, and in December joins the Schlossplatz and Marktplatz, on either side of Schillerplatz, as home to the Christmas Market. One side of the square is formed by the Alte Kanzlei (Old Chancellery), and on the southwest side is the old Fruchtkasten (Granary) dating from 1390, and adjoining it, the choir of the Stiftskirche.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Stuttgart

places.name: Schillerplatz

reviews.text: Schillerplatz is considered Old Town of Stuttgart. The square is smaller but beautifully designed and the architecture is beautiful. Highly recommend.

This is a small and charming urban square in the Old Town of Stuttgart named after German Poet Friedrich Schiller (1759-1805). The square is fairly small but nicely framed by Altes Schloss, Stiftskirche and other nice buildings.

There is a early 19th-century monument of Schiller worth seeing and the square is a major part of the annual Christmas Market being filled with highly decorative stalls and large crowds at this time of the year. It was quite the festive scene during our recent visit.

Schillerplatz is a stately cobbled square in Stuttgart's old town, anchored by a commanding bronze monument to Friedrich Schiller, one of Germany's most revered poets and playwrights. Erected in 1839, it was the first public monument in Germany dedicated to a civilian. Today, it's surrounded by Renaissance architecture and lively caf√©s, offering a dignified yet inviting place to pause amid the city's historic heart.

places.generalDescription: The Hohenheimer Garden is a large and beautiful botanical garden with an arboretum, pasture, and botanical gardens. It is a popular place to walk and is free to enter. It has a great variety of plants from flowers to trees, of exotic or native origin that can be studied or admired.
places.name: Hohenheimer Garden

reviews.text: I visited this garden in March and had a nice little walk there. The view from the Monopteros is great, offering a lovely panorama of the area. It's a nice garden with peaceful path.
Great walk. Amazing trees. Most flowers were already blown. Out of season.

I am always delighted to come back and visit these gardens. Large and beautiful place to spend a relaxing time walking, taking pictures or sitting on a bench, reading a book or just looking at the scenery. Access is free. It is simply an amazing place. Those who are passionate and knowledgeable here find a lot of plant species from flowers to trees, of exotic or native origin that they can simply study or admire.

places.generalDescription: LKA Longhorn, located in the Wangen district of Stuttgart, is a spacious club and concert venue known for its vibrant atmosphere and energetic live music events. The nightclub hosts rock and alternative music parties while also featuring concerts ranging from metal to pop rock. Visitors praise the venue for its ability to bring out the best in artists across various genres. With a dedicated and helpful staff, this long-standing establishment has been a go-to destination for live music enthusiasts for over 25 years.

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: LKA Longhorn

reviews.text: Very nice concert hall for small events. Good location. Well maintained and operated.
Good venue, located by an industrial area so parking is a bit weird.

I'm actually making a review from a show I saw here in 2011. Saw the Mighty Mighty Bosstones play here and I had an absolute blast. I am literally still telling people about this show and venue 13 years later.

Thanks for being awesome! Such a great venue to experience a wonderful ska show at.

places.generalDescription: Johanneskirche und Kirchengemeinde Stuttgart-West, also known as St. John's Evangelical Church, is a stunning Protestant church in neo-Gothic style located in Stuttgart. Built between 1864 and 1876, it stands out for its urban location on a peninsula overlooking the picturesque Feuersee (Lake of Fire). Although partially reconstructed after World War II, the church remains incomplete by design.

sources.snippet: Kunst- und Antiquit√§tenmarkt auf dem Karlsplatz: Besuchen Sie den Kunst- und Antiquit√§tenmarkt auf dem Karlsplatz und suchen Sie nach einzigartigen Sch√§tzen.
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Johanneskirche und Kirchengemeinde Stuttgart-West

reviews.text:
An unusual, but beautiful and impressive church with its U-shaped pond, inhabited by ducks, swans and herons.

It is a pity that many people around do not know how to appreciate either historical objects or nature and pollute the pond with various garbage: glass bottles, plastic and other...

A beautiful and peaceful church right in the heart of the city. Johanneskirche has stunning architecture and offers a calm, relaxing vibe-perfect for a short break or quiet walk. The area around it is nice, though the lake could be better maintained. Still, the overall atmosphere is charming and definitely worth a visit if you're nearby.

St. John's Evangelic church at lake Feuersee is maybe Stuttgart's most iconic church. It's beautiful setting at the lake creates lovely reflections and greenery around lives the seasons. The opening hours are very restricted, so it is better to look up before you go. I wanted to visit on a Saturday and it is actually closed on Saturdays.

places.generalDescription: Birkenkopf, also known as "Monte Scherbelino" or "Mount Rubble," is the highest point in Stuttgart, standing at 511 meters above sea level. It is a literal mountain of rubble from the ruins of the city after World War II. The hill serves as a memorial to the war's victims and a warning to future generations.

sources.snippet: To get a glimpse of history and a great view at once, head to Birkenkopf. Also known as Rubble Hill, this hill has been built up by rubble and remnants of war. This is evident by the pieces of buildings overgrown by shrubs and grass.
sources.shortName: 28 Unique Things To Do in Stuttgart, Germany [2025] -
52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Birkenkopf

reviews.text: A place with historical importance and a stunning panoramic view of the city of Stuttgart. I went there on Silvester and the view of the city was simply unforgettable. It's also a good hike to reach the top.

A war memorial constructed from WWII rubble, Birkenkopf symbolizes Stuttgart's post-war reconstruction. Standing 511 meters high, it provides a historical perspective on the city's destruction and rebuilding efforts while offering scenic views.
Easy climb uphill with a fantastic view of Stuttgart and its suburbs. Accessible via private cars and public transportation. From the Parkplatz downhill, it's an easy 10-20 mins trek uphill.

places.generalDescription: Rosensteinpark is a large formal park established between 1824-1840 by King Wilhelm, featuring old trees, meadows, paths, and ponds. The park also houses historical landmarks such as Rosenstein Castle and the Museum am Lowentor. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks amidst blooming flowers and chirping birds in spring.

sources.snippet: Einer der sch√∂nsten  Parks in Stuttgart, mit weitl√§ufigen Wiesen, dem Biergarten Flora & Fauna und einer sch√∂nen Aussicht auf das Naturkundemuseum Schloss Rosenstein. Setzt euch ins hohe Gras oder auf eine Parkbank und vergesst die Zeit um euch herum, denn dazu ist der Park am besten geeignet: Die Ruhe zu genie√üen und sich aufeinander einzulassen!
sources.shortName: Dating-Spots in Stuttgart

sources.snippet: Don't forget to immerse yourselves in the local culture by enjoying a leisurely stroll through the beautiful Rosenstein Park, featuring stunning landscapes and charming gardens.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A romantic day trip to Stuttgart, Germany

sources.snippet: Picknick im Rosensteinpark: Packen Sie einen Korb mit Leckereien und verbringen Sie einen entspannten Nachmittag bei einem Picknick im malerischen Rosensteinpark.
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Rosensteinpark

reviews.text: Huge park spanning from HBF till L√∂wentor. Good place for walking cycling and kids play areas are available

It's a really big park, it's absolutely vast, lovely tarmac paths take you along the many beautiful trees, some are amazing to look at, there is wildlife with many beautiful ducks, there is a playground in the making, dianasourus style, there is a museum container within a very historic building of beauty, ponds and play areas, it really is a lovely place to relax in
It's a great park for families ,  pets, and kitas!

places.generalDescription: If you're looking for a unique and enjoyable evening, Autokino Kornwestheim is the perfect destination for a memorable date night. This drive-in movie theater offers an inviting atmosphere where you can kick back in your car and enjoy films under the stars. With a selection of movies that cater to various tastes, it's an experience unlike any other. Visitors have praised the quality of both picture and sound, ensuring that your cinematic adventure is immersive.

sources.snippet: Look forward to a special date night at the drive-in movie theater in Kornwestheim!. Relax together in the car and enjoy the best movies in the open air. Grab some snacks, snuggle up and experience cinema in a different way!
sources.shortName: The coolest date ideas in Stuttgart

places.name: Autokino Kornwestheim / DWJ GmbH

reviews.text: The screen for kids movies is not so big but it bright enough to watch during the day. Very nice experience. I felt in 80's.

I have watches many movies there. Easily park you car and watch. The problem I face is that there are no original movies offered.

You can also buy snacks there including popcorn.

A tip: make sure your car battery and radio are good!

So it's good old school film watching. What's cooler than a drive in movie right? But it's also true that the screen is a little dark for details and there's a tree/bush growing in the corner which just takes away the magic of the occasion.
So over all..
Worth a visit.
Could be better.
All the best a movie lover.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Stuttgart, Max-Eyth-See is a stunning lake and nature reserve that has transformed from an old quarry into a beloved recreational haven. Locals affectionately refer to it as 'The Eythy,' and it's easy to see why! This enchanting spot invites visitors to unwind amidst lush greenery, making it feel like you've stepped into a fairy tale.

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Max-Eyth-See

reviews.text: I came here on a weekday afternoon and felt really nice to see walk around for any age group. Worth every minute.

Nice park to begin with , long trails for walking , jogging, and bicycling . You can relax by the lake on one of the benches , grab a bite in one of the surrounding restaurants , take the boat for ‚Ç¨7 for 30 mins, come with family and friends and use the barbecue grills, or sit on the beach chairs and sun bathe. Parking available in more than one spot around the lake. I visited the park on a moderately hot weekday and the clouds saved us every now and then from the heat of the sun . The only missing star is because the lake is full of moss, smelly in some parts and that restricted the area where we can go with the boat and made peddling a hard task.

Awesome place for walk, boating, hiking, PARTY (you can grill there, use your tents to stay) (you are allowed to grill 8am-8pm)

Toilets are also there same like in other fests.

places.generalDescription: Impressive tower built in 1904 to honor Bismarck, one of a series, with a beacon for lighting.

sources.snippet: Wir geben es zu, wir kriegen einfach nicht genug von Dating-Spots mit einem Panorama Blick √ºber unsere sch√∂ne Stadt. Auf unserer Dating-Spot Liste darf der  Bismarckturm nicht fehlen. Packt die Picknickdecke ein und Snacks ‚Äì et voi¬≠l√†, einem perfekten Date steht nichts mehr im Wege.
sources.shortName: Dating-Spots in Stuttgart

places.name: Bismarckturm Stuttgart

reviews.text: Fantastic view of Stuttgart. A place to walk and relax. The road is narrow but still free parking can be found. The other side of the road is offered also for afternoon sun bathing.

My favourite viewpoint in Stuttgart! You can see the beautiful city centre and landmarks from here all the way to the iconic TV tower (Fernsehturm), take in the lush green hills while sitting peacefully on one of the many benches or low stone walls, or walk along the many paths leading up and downhill from this scenic point. Accessible and open 24/7 with no tickets needed, this is a great spot to hang out at or visit. To watch the sunset you can just cross over to the other side of the street for another panoramic hill. There's even a table tennis table, although it can often be too windy to play, given the openness of the area. Definitely recommend visiting if you're in Stuttgart, no matter the season!

One of the most beautiful spots in Stuttgart.
There‚Äòs a large garden that‚Äòs great for chilling, grilling and drone flying.

Breathtaking overview.

places.generalDescription: Karlsplatz in Stuttgart is a must-visit destination, especially on Saturdays when it hosts a popular flea market that has been a tradition for over 30 years. The market features around 45 vendors selling all kinds of used goods, making it the perfect spot to hunt for unique finds and great deals.

sources.snippet: Bummel durch den Flohmarkt am Karlsplatz: St√∂bern Sie gemeinsam durch die St√§nde des Flohmarkts am Karlsplatz und entdecken Sie Sch√§tze aus vergangenen Zeiten.
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Karlsplatz

reviews.text: Great place for events celebrations
old square with Kaiser wilhelm 1 majestic memorial and surrounded by trees.

A historic and lively square in central Stuttgart, best known for its weekend flea market, local food stalls, and proximity to major landmarks like the Altes Schloss (Old Castle) and Landesmuseum W√ºrttemberg. Surrounded by mature trees and open-air caf√©s, it's a relaxed place to pause between sightseeing stops.

The square often hosts events and markets, offering a great mix of local flavor and culture. A statue of Kaiser Wilhelm I stands at the center, adding historical context to the urban charm. It's also a key transit point with easy access to K√∂nigstra√üe and Schlossplatz nearby.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Stuttgart, Park Villa Berg is a charming green oasis that dates back to the 19th century. This beautifully landscaped park features winding trails, lush meadows, and playful equipment for children, making it an ideal spot for families and nature enthusiasts alike. The villa itself was constructed between 1845 and 1853 in the elegant Italian Renaissance style for Crown Prince Karl of Wurttemberg and his wife Olga Nikolaevna of Russia.

sources.snippet: Du bist auf der Suche nach einem Park in Stuttgart, der nicht √ºberlaufen und ein Geheimtipp ist?. Dann empfehlen wir Verliebten den  Villa Berg Park. Hier k√∂nnt ihr picknicken, durch den Park schlendern und es sich auf einer Bank zwischen den Obstb√§umen gem√ºtlich machen.
sources.shortName: Dating-Spots in Stuttgart

places.name: Park Villa Berg

reviews.text:
Very nice old building ü´∂üèº
Good architecture!
What a great experience in the forest in Stuttgart. I felt like Hansel and Gretel..
Great place for any outdoor activity or simply for relaxing. The park has plenty of open space and a nice restaurant.

places.generalDescription: Sky Beach Stuttgart is a unique rooftop bar that brings a taste of the shore to the city of Stuttgart. With its sand-covered rooftop, deck chairs, and daybeds, it offers a lively and relaxed atmosphere with stunning city views. Open from April to September, it's perfect for weekend day drinking or late evening hangouts.

sources.snippet: Besuch des Mercedes-Benz-Kundenzentrums: Erleben Sie die Zukunft Mobilit√§t hautnah und erkunde die neuesten Innovation im Mercedes-Benz-Kundenzentrum. (danach wird aber direkt geheiratet)
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Sky Beach Stuttgart

reviews.text:
I guess it's one of the best rooftop place in Stuttgart and it's in the heart of the city.
The prices of drinks are a bit pricey, but it's okay.
The sand is soft and it feels like the beach atmosphere.
You need to order the drinks at the counter and after you finish you need to return your empty glass to the counter to get your deposit (Pfand) back.
The lounge chairs are comfortable and the beds as well!
The toilet is very basic, and there's an employee that is responsible to take care of the toilet area and he expects you to pay small coins for using the toilet. It's bit funny, they should change that!
Overall it's a good place and you can watch the sunset from there!

I would not recommend this bar based on my recent experience. They continue letting people in even when the venue is clearly over capacity and there are no available seats. You're required to pay an entrance fee upfront, but once inside, you might find yourself standing the entire time or squeezed into uncomfortable corners.

When I asked for a refund due to the lack of seating, the staff were not only unhelpful but also confrontational, insisting they were in the right despite the situation. The way they handled the matter was unprofessional and disrespectful.

It's unfortunate, because with better management and customer service, this place could offer a much more enjoyable experience. As it stands, I'd suggest looking elsewhere for a night out.

Super cute place to enjoy a sunny, warm day. However, with there being no table service, the wait to get a drink was between 20-30mins, meaning we left after one drink. I'd happily pay more for a drink if I could order from my seat üòé

places.generalDescription: Kraftpaule is a craft beer house located in the eastern part of Stuttgart, near Stockach. It was established in March 2016 by a group of beer enthusiasts led by Thorsten Schwammle. They have turned their passion for beer into a profession and even organize the successful Stuttgarter Craftbeer Festival every spring, attracting international guests and offering an impressive program.

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Kraftpaule - Craft Beer in Stuttgart

reviews.text:
A very friendly, relaxed craft ale bar with an excellent range of German beer (try the dunkel!) ordered alongside their interpretation of foreign styles and examples from guest breweries. Their fridges also carry a range of excellent beers including a delightful m√§rzen, but here I must admit their stock of imported British beers contained some very odd examples!

Friendly, knowledgeable and warm service is to be found, backed by a somewhat limited food menu albeit served at a quality that was beyond reproach.

In all, I cannot imagine why any enthusiastic craft ale drinker would even consider going for a drink anywhere other than at Kraftpaule whilst in Stuttgart. You simply cannot do better.

The Kraftpaule is one of those places I just can't go with the overall trend of great ratings.   The place has potential but the evening I went there was a bit to be desired.  The service was poor - the gent taking our orders had the personality of a dishrag.  The place was busy but we seemed to be a burden for being there.  The draft dunkel beer was just ok - nothing to write home about.  Food was mediocre- I had the Swabian noodles which was just ok.   All in all I really wanted to leave a better review but this is the review they earned.

Prefect craft beer venue. The beer is great with a good selection. The tacos rival those in Texas (they do need to double stack the corn tortillas though).

If more than one in your party, it will likely be difficult to find a seat in the evening.

places.generalDescription: DAS LEUZE, also known as the LEUZE Mineralbad, is a renowned mineral bath complex featuring nine swimming and bathing pools spread across 18,000 square feet. Additionally, it offers fourteen saunas and steam rooms covering 35,500 square feet. The facility includes a dedicated children's area with paddling and wading pools spanning 6450 square feet. The water originates from two highly carbonated springs and one mineral spring.

sources.snippet: Treat yourself to some time out at Leuze and relax in the various pools or the sauna. Here you can unwind together and simply switch off. Perfect for a relaxed date full of relaxation and feel-good moments!
sources.shortName: The coolest date ideas in Stuttgart

places.name: DAS LEUZE

reviews.text: Love this place. We come here every time we are in Stuttgart. There are swimming pools of all different temperatures, a mineral bath, lots of hammam with different scents, saunas of various temperatures and even now an ice room. The panorama sauna is the best with a great view over the river and park. Gorgeous in all seasons. There are lots of places to lie and sunbake or rest between saunas‚Ä¶ and it's included no Urban Sports Club.

Das Leuze in Stuttgart is amazing! I really loved the layout. It's well-designed and has a great atmosphere. The staff were super friendly, which added to the positive experience. The only downside was that the main pool felt a bit cold at times, but everything else was perfect. We're already planning to go back next week! Y'all should visit it

A very relaxing thermal mineral bath experience in Stuttgart. Can get really crowded though, especially on holidays and weekends, so be prepared to have to jostle a bit to get some good spots to relax in the baths and jacuzzi.

places.generalDescription: The Chinese Garden in Stuttgart, also known as the "Garden of Beautiful Melodies," is a serene and traditional park featuring meandering paths, a pavilion, and a waterfall. This famous park offers visitors the opportunity to enjoy leisurely strolls amidst lush green spaces, large trees, and captivating water ponds. Reflecting the world in miniature according to Chinese tradition, the garden provides a soothing yin and yang atmosphere with stunning views over Stuttgart's valley basin.
places.name: Chinese Garden Stuttgart

reviews.text:
Nice and peaceful place for a quick stress relief.

Need to do a kind of trekking for almost 15-20 mins from main station. Of course there is also a bus that goes near to this place but this is no fun.

So, just to be clear, the garden is beautiful, however, it seems like there's not much upkeep. There was a lot of trash everywhere and scribbling on the walls, very sad, this place has such good harmony‚Ä¶ I guess if they charged for entering it would be different, but then it will miss the whole point‚Ä¶ I don't know.

If you decide to come here please don't leave trash everywhere, and maybe pick up some of the trash lying around, that would be helpful. Be quiet too, this garden is a sanctuary, noise is disrespectful, even if it's your kid making the noise, that's bad parenting, okay for babies and toddlers, but teach your kids some good manners.

Had to climb 150+ steps n walk like a km from the S-Bahn to reach the top, but the view of Stuttgart makes it worth it. Chinese garden itself ain't much, but def a cool spot to chill n city gaze if weather's good. Would def recommend for the views.

places.generalDescription: The Weinbaumuseum Stuttgart is a must-visit for wine enthusiasts, offering a fascinating journey through the history of wine production in the region. Housed in a former wine-making facility, the museum showcases historical artifacts and viticulture-related art, providing insight into both historic and modern viticulture in Stuttgart. Visitors can also enjoy tasting opportunities at the museum's gift shop, making it an ideal complement to vineyard tours and wine tastings in the area.
places.name: Weinbaumuseum Stuttgart

reviews.text:
Very educational tour given by Mr Wolfgang Mack (probably the boss/owner, most likely a very experienced sommelier; I didn't ask). Overall great service, made us feel very welcome, like at a friend's house.

He recommended us a fruity white (Collegium Wirtemberg, 2015 M√ºller-Thurgau feinherb) which was wonderful - the first white wine I actually liked, and I don't even drink.

Interesting wine museum in Stuttgart that express the story and dewelopment of wineyards in BW. Its clear that wine quality not the best but good.  Inside is full of historical samples from the old days. I like the old wine openers. At the entrance you can taste some local wines. It would make a better marketing if they include the wine tasting in the ticket and increase little bit the entrance fee:)

Test their own wine brand
Red one was especially great

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

reviews.text: Went on a Sunday morning. It was super peaceful. A great time to go. Staff at front desk spoke English and we're very cheerful and helpful. Try the salt scrub sauna, probably my favourite.

What an awful experience with the staff, especially the rude older blonde woman at reception.Offering zero kindness or helpfulness. When I asked why she was being so rude, she just continued with the same dismissive attitude.
If I could give negative stars, I would rate this place -10. I drove 300 km just to be treated with disrespect. I absolutely do not recommend this place-look for somewhere that actually values and respects its guests!

My experience at the Private spa was okay. Not what I expected but I did the most out of it. It's nothing extra-ordinary for the price paid. The public bathroom at the changing area was a bit not clean and also had a weird smell.
My worst experience was the Customer Service. I called to indicate I'll be a little bit late only to be shouted at because my German was not good. That lady on the call (didn't get her name well ) just outright shouted at me when I tried to explain myself and also because I didn't understand some German words she used. I only tried to understand her but ‚Ä¶..
Also the customer service at the reception is wanting. I think they can do better.

sources.snippet: Stuttgart Ballett oder Oper: Genie√üen Sie einen Abend voller Kultur und Eleganz bei einer Auff√ºhrung im Stuttgarter Ballett oder in der Oper.
sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) A beautiful building! Great ambience. A world-class ballet and a fantastic opera! Everything laid out in a modern way. And the best thing... Tickets for third place are available for under ‚Ç¨10 including VVS... Everyone can afford it...

(Original)
Ein wundersch√∂nes Geb√§ude! Tolles Ambiente. Ein Weltklasse Ballett und eine phantastische Oper! Alles modern aufgelegt. Und das beste.. Karten f√ºr den dritten Rang gibt es schon f√ºr unter 10‚Ç¨ inkl. Vvs... Da kann sich jeder Kultur leisten..

(Translated by Google) World class ballet - choreography, costumes, set design - everything is unsurpassable! The opera house is of course wonderful too!

(Original)
Weltklasse Ballett - Choreographie, Kost√ºme, B√ºhnenbild - alles un√ºbertrefflich! Das Opernhaus ist nat√ºrlich auch wundervoll!

(Translated by Google) Wonderful ballet. Perfection, emotion, grace, aesthetics, simply great!!!

(Original)
Wunderbares Ballett. Perfektion, Emotion,  Grazie, √Ñsthetik,  einfach gro√üartig!!!

places.generalDescription: If you're searching for the perfect musical accompaniment for your special day, look no further than Trio Merlot Jazz Trio Hochzeitsband. This talented band has a knack for creating an enchanting atmosphere at weddings, whether during the ceremony, reception, or dinner. With their exceptional musical skills and the stunning voice of singer Maria, they truly elevate any event. Guests rave about their performances, noting how they made moments like champagne receptions unforgettable.

sources.shortName: 52 Date Ideen f√ºr Stuttgart und die Region

places.name: Trio Merlot Jazz Trio Hochzeitsband Jazzband Stuttgart

reviews.text: We have booked Trio Merlot for our wedding and it was incredible! Strong recommendation for Brian an the remaining team

(Translated by Google) Trio Merlot provided musical accompaniment to our wedding. The band was just great and very professional. Our song requests for the wedding were implemented perfectly and the band was also very flexible and friendly on site.

(Original)
Trio Merlot hat unsere Hochzeit musikalisch begleitet. Die Band war einfach super und sehr professionell. Unsere Liedw√ºnsche f√ºr die Trauung wurden perfekt umgesetzt und die Band war auch vor Ort sehr flexibel und freundlich.

(Translated by Google) You were the perfect complete package for our wedding. Your music during dinner was just perfect and was a huge hit. The party afterwards with you as the DJ was also really great.

I would definitely recommend it again. The communication was also top-notch, both by email and on the phone. We were also immediately pleasant in person.

Thank you so much for the unforgettable evening.

(Original)
F√ºr unsere Hochzeit wart ihr das perfekte Komplet Packet. Eure Musik zu Essen war einfach super passend und kam auch mega an. Auch das sp√§tere abfeiern mit euch als DJ echt super.

Auf jeden Fall immer wieder zu Empfehlen. Auch der Kontakt war eins a. Per Mail oder auch am Telefon. Pers√∂hnlich auch sofort sympatisch.

Besten dank an euch f√ºr den unvergesslichen Abend.
